description:
The image above shows the measured light-curves of the  Exoplanet CoRoT-18b and the Variable star ASASSN-V J063307.38-000204.9 did on January 11 2021.
CoRoT-18b is the fourth transiting  Exoplanet measured by me ðŸ˜Š

Exoplanet CoRoT-18b is a Hot Jupiter class planet located in the constellation Monoceros, found by the CoRoT space telescope in 2011
Radius : 1,3 Jupiter
Mass : 3,4 Jupiter
Orbital period : 1,9 day
The host Star is a Sun-like star with Radius of 1 x Sun.

Variable star ASASSN-V J063307.38-000204.9
W Ursae Majoris-type eclipsing variable
Period : 9.2 hour
Amplitude : 0,7 Mag (measured by me) is a pretty high value.
I made a gif (Rev. D) where the brightness difference is very good to see.
The gif contains 2 raw images of 2 minutes (maxima and minima ).
The elapsed time between the two images is approx. 1 hour
title: Exoplanet CoRoT-18b and Variable star ASASSN-V J063307.38-000204.9
